alert.note: Alert for Northern Jackson; Southern Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 1:47PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jackson County through 215 PM CDT... At 146 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds near Helena, or near Grand Bay, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Escatawpa, Big Point, Helena, Hurley and Vancleave. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 74 and 76. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
